When I first started working with the company I currently am employed with (10 years!  Gah!!) there was this chic Mitzi that worked there.  We are the same age and we got along swimmingly.  Mostly because 70% of the time we were together we were drunk. 
Mitz lived with two other girls and this guy.  She was always telling me that this guy was so hot and that I HAD to meet him, but all attempts seem to fail miserably.  PLUS I was dating Russ at the time and I LOOVED Russ.  That is, until Russ moved to DC.  Oh, I still loved him, but the love was fettered by Distance.  And, really, how can a 22 year old really LOVE someone who they never can have sex with? 
So, one night, all of us crazy kids from work decided to go to a Piano Bar and get silly intoxicated.  Mitz said she invited This Guy. 
And, I knew who he was the second he walked into the bar.  I didnt even have to ask Mitz if this was This Guy.  I knew. 
He mooooved into the bar all Swingeresque in his black velvet shirt with white satin trim, Calvin Kelins sagging just a titch, and black Doc Martin shoes.  Not boots.  Gah!  Oh!  SO DREAMY!  All Red Haired and Slenderly Tall.  Two silver hoops adorning each lobe.  Hot ass goatee and cool sideburns. 
I went up the This Guy and introduced myself as Mitzi's friend Jen From Work.  Immediately following that introduction I asked him if he wanted to go to the Tori Amos concert in a couple of weeks.  And right after that I asked if he wanted to go dancing.  Tonite. Right now.  Because I NEEDED to see This Guy's body move. 
And we danced.  And then we had breakfast.  And then I went home with him because he was easy, I could tell. 
And, then?  The next morning Mitzi woke us up and asked us if we wanted to go to a State Football game with her and her boyfriend and we did.  After the game This Guy drove me home in his 1976 Lincoln Towne Car and promised to call me tomorrow.  And he did. 

Shortly thereafter, This Guy, knocked me up and after 7 long and hard and fun years, This Guy took me as his wife.  Because he loves me long time. 

BUT, the point to my story is this:  Shortly after I had Holden, Mitzi met some guy from VA and abruptly moved out of state, never to be heard from again. 
And, we all missed her and wondered why she never called!  Why she left us all high and dry.  All these years I have missed her and loved her for being The Girl Who Gave Me Big Hands. 
Then?  Thursday night?  I check myspace and lo and flipping behold, who should have left me a message? MITZI!!!!!!!!!  I almost swallowed my gum!  I messaged her back and told her to give me her phone number.  And she did, and we talked for an hour!  HA!  How do you like that?!  It was so fabulous to talk to her!  I still cant believe that Myspace actually IS GOOD FOR SOMETHING!!   
And, now I have my friend back.  And, I hope I never lose touch with her again.  For if it werent for her?  There wouldnt be this fabulous Me. 
Thank you Mitz!

I seriously debated whether or not to even guide you here:  http://www.finslippy.com/finslippy/2007/06/aint-got-no-min.html
But, obviously I made a decision.

I love Hair.  I mean, I used to be a collegehippiewannabe.  My long tresses in two braids.  Flowy skirts.  Smoking pot and painting the walls of our art building hallways in the middle of the night cuz we were trippin'.
Yeah.  THEN?  I grew out of that.
But I still love Hair.  Long beautiful hair.
You know?  And I also love Fergie, and Outkast, and Eminem, and Snoop, and The Streets, and All That Is Punk.
But.  Am I gonna let my kid sing along to Bitchin' Camaro?  Um, no.  Because it says Bitchin.  I do not want him to say bitchin.  Because of on account I would have to flick his lips.

And, I think Bowie is amazing and incredibly sexy.  But just because I think something is good, should I expose my son to it?

I used to like to get super high and go to Meijer.  Perhaps Holden would enjoy an occasional freak out?

Maybe its just me being a Beta Mom...
But, I just dont discuss Free Love with my seven year old. 
In my house?  We are the boss.  My HUSBAND AND I.  We two.  And, though it is not a dictatorship, that little dude does what the hell I tell him to do.  Because children LEARN from HOW you do.  And WHAT you do.  And, I dont, by FAR , think Ive got it all figured out, but there are things I can love and not want my kid to love them just yet.  This is why there are so many effing BRATTY ass kids out there.  Because their parents want them to have their own experiences.  And make up their own minds.  Eff that.  You can make up your own mind when I dont pour your cereal and pick out your clothes anymore.  And, even then, I probably wont trust you completely because you've made some poor choices, buddy, and I dont really like that kid you are hanging out with and HELL NO you cant spend the night at Ashley's house, I dont give a hoot WHAT her parents say, they let her watch HAIR when she was five!  You wanna pay for your own tuition to University?  Fine then buddy.  You just go ahead and do that.

The wider mind of the Alpha mom?  I want less and less to do with it.  Im trying to wean myself off her blog, but you know...I just like to get all riled up.



~~~~~~~~~~In other news

Holden had his last Baseball Game last nite and they all played so well.  It was awesome!  Holden even got a hit!  And actually FIELDED some grounders.  I was amazed.  Of course, there was the promise of Ice Cream after the game...I had a blast with this, and even though Holden could give a rats ass about organized sports, Id sign him up again in a minute.  There are lessons to learn from these kinds of things.  Lessons an only child would be better for learning.  Like Team Work.  YAY TEAM!

Big Hands?  Right this very instant?  Is in the STUDIO.  I know.  For the SECOND time.  They are so very cool.  I can hardly even stand it!  Hopefully this record will help them get some gigs at more reputable bars.  

I will be moving to a new office on Monday!  Im so excited for a change.  And, even though our new phone numbers and what nots are STILL not in place...I still will be somewhere new.  With two people I love to work with.  Its gonna be a gas!

Party Time tonite, friends.  Holler.

They made the right choices tonite, my friends.  I only wish I had been watching it alone. 

Party Time+Big Hands=Big Hands is a total dick.

I just dont like Alpha Moms.

Am I just oversensetive?
On one hand, I can totally relate.
On the other hand Im like, Oh.  Poor you.  One whole week.  Gah.
Im oversensetive, huh??

soooo.....Chicago last weekend...I love my sister in law.  Ness is the Best Person Ever.  Seriously.  There is not a bad thing about her.  At all. 
SO alls Im gonna say about my weekend in ChiTown was that at 8am on Sunday?  When Big Hands called me?  To ask HOW MANY SCOOPS OF COFFEE YOU PUT IN THE POT?  I pretty much was Still Drunk. 
When we all subsequently got up and Ness made us go eat breakfast?  Which we had to WALK three blocks to?  Still Drunk. 
And Im not ashamed of it.   
Most of us complain that we never get to go out and have fun. 
I am married to Big Hands.  He does what he wants; what I let him.  Because you know why?  He lets me do what I want; what he lets me do. 
Suffice it to say, I made a lot of friends Saturday night at Rockit.  I may have molested the bar manager, Peter.  Maybe I did.  Maybe I didnt.  But really.  When you play Purple Rain?  Especially for me?   What the hell do you expect of me???  I apparently will hunt you down like a rabid dog until I corner you until you CANT move.  And then, I will dance on you.  Be forewarned.  Lord knows what would have happened had it been Erotic City.  Gads! 
I may have given every one who was seated a lap dance.  Perhaps... 
Theres a good chance that Peter played EVERYONE OF MY FAVORITE SONGS and I mighta sang every one of 'em.  I may have let Nessie's latest conquest, Todd, twirl me around the bar like a baton. 
But whilst doing all these inappropriate things?  Manalicious, did I look smokin' hot. 
And, I am NOT ashamed of it.

Its official, just today.  This boy is in third grade!  Woopah!  How on earth did he get so big?  In two months he will be eight.  Didnt we just read Now We Are Six??
Where, where did the time go?

I remember when he was born.  And, I thought for sure he was going to bore me to TEARS with his not talking and having to be carried EVERYWHERE!  Ugh! Because, see?  Im not so much a baby person.  But, to get to the two year old, you have to have the two month old.  Some people, they like the baby.  Not so much me.  And, I like OTHER people's babies even less.  Im sure you'd have me feel bad about this, but I will not.  BOOOOORING.  They eat, sleep and poop.  Thbbbt.

And, so when Holden started walking and talking (early, I may add, because I just wasnt having any of it) I was thrilled!  And, soon enough after that, the diaper became Big Boy Underwins (I dont know why, thats just what we called them...) and the plug became no more.  And now we are talking in full sentences, and climbing UP the slide.  The slide that is very very high.  And now we are sliding down that slide and writing in cursive.  
And now we are almost eight and in the third grade.

WE ARE IN THE THIRD GRADE.

That is big time stuff, my friends.  Big. Time. Stuff.  I would now like the hands of time to stop.  Hammertime, okay?  Because now?  We are moving way too fast and soon he will be married.  And, then?  I will have to spend all my time with Big Hands.  Alone. 
Have you met this man?  God help me.

Third Grade.  With a Game Boy.  We are big.  We are BIG.  Now, we are Growing Up.

This show is probably the best thing on tv right now.  This is because I love dancing and everything to do with it.  Especially lyrical/modern dancing, because I will cry every time.  As Holden so eloquently put it during last season, "this show is in my heart, mom".  This show IS in MY heart.
So we were watching it, and the first girl comes on and says, Blah blah blah, 23 years old...
Holden says, "she's younger than you"  I say, "thanks for noticing"
He says, "young...but pretty"  Very matter of factly, as such.
And, the girl with the Big Hair?  He says that he liked her in Vegas, but now that he's seen her with a partner?  "She's really really good mom, and this is because she is really REALLY pretty."
SO.  At least he isnt shallow.

I wanted to not like Benji's sister, because, like I said, I like the men, and I like 'em lyrical.  But tonite, she and her partner blew me away with that lyrical dance.  I cried.  It was gorgeous.
And, I like Hawk.  But, Im still waiting to see if he can do anything else other than street dancing.

I promise, soon, I will commit some of thier names to memory.  Hawk is the only one that is sticking right now.
And, did you see Travis from last year in the audience?  So cute.

ONE LAST THING:
Terabithia is coming to DVD soon and Holden says, "Dont get me wrong mom, but I thought that was a bad movie.  But not bad as in not good, just bad as in I bet people thought they were going to see a happy movie, but it turns out to be sad, and those will be some disappointed people."
Always looking out for the faint of heart, that kid.

My nieces and nephew go to a Very Small Church School.  I could rant and rave about that place, but I digress...today was the All School Sing.  Its where all the kids that go to that school, you know, sing.  In church.
And, it is always so cute because of all of the Littles.  But when you lump the whole school together, there will be the High School.  And, in High School there are Teenage Girls.  I. Dont. Like. Teenage. Girls.
So the whole school (about 30 kids K-12..ack!) singing in front of the entire congregation and the Littles are just Too Cute singing their little hearts out.  And, then.  In the back row?  Sullen Unsmiley Teenage Girls.  Ruining the whole thing with their Imjusttoocooltobestandinguphere, soinanattempttoshoweverybodyhowcoolIam, Imjust gonnastandherewithmymouthalldroopy-like.  I wanted to punch them in their snotty little mouths.  Let me tell you; you just dont want to have that feeling in church!

Home again, home again jiggetyjig!  Today?  I weed whipped.  Anybody ever done that before?  Makes your whole body vibrate.  Feels gooooooooood!  My backyard looks dlishus!  And, Big Hands moved my Bird Bath over to the "garden area" (hint:  there is no garden there.) and it just looks great.  Kellie, you'll have to come see.

So then, the sun is shining and Holden is at the neighbors and I say, HEY! We own this here land!  There really is no reason I cant go out into my backyard IN MY BATHING SUIT, and lay out in the sun, huh?
And, so friends, I did.  And, I read the whole article on Angelina Jolie (or as I like to call her: Angerliner Joler) in this months Esquire.  And it was good.  SHe is good.  Brad Pitts back on my top ten just for shacking up with her. And having so many babies!  With her!
And, also I read some of the Chuck Klosterman book Im reading called Sex Drugs and Coco Puffs.  If you are between the ages of 28-35 this book will speak to you on so many different levels!  I love him!

Then, BH went to Band Practice and my neighbors asked if Holden and I wanted to eat over there.  They were having a barbeque with some other neighbors.
I have to tell you, my across the street neighbors are probably The Nicest People Ever.  They are good and Catholic right down in there souls.  I am grateful for neighbors such as these.  And the other couple live down at the end of our street, but are equally as nice.  It was really a good time.  And this is why:  I like to be liked.  I mean, if you dont like me, I like to be all Your Loss Suckah.  But really Im thinking, Why dont they like me?  What is WRONG with them?  What is wrong with ME?? OH LIKE ME< IM NICE!!  That is because I am needy; shh, dont tell.
SO it was nice to have dinner with Neighborly Friends.  Because that is all I have ever wanted in a neighborhood.  To make friends with the adults whose kids MY kid is INCESSANTLY playing with.  THEY have four kids.  One teenage girl, who is not at all like the above mentioned Teenage Girls.  Kelsey is NICE and GOOD.  But, they also have THREE boys.  Holden is in HEAVEN!

Today was a good day.
I like that.  I like good days.  Where nothing much happens, but it means the world anyway!

It was so nice of you to stop by and visit!  i was touched that you came by.  You wonder when you are going to start becoming irrelevent.
And now, I have to go shower for Church.  The Lord likes me clean.
Mwah!

Its been a lifetime.
Mom is well.  Home.  But, lets not fool ourselves; she has cancer.  There.  Its been said.  Again.  But, thats all I want to say about that right now.  Sometimes, when you let it out, its just not yours anymore.  I need mine.  The end.

In other news....
Im going to Chicago next weekend.  This makes me jump up with glee.  See me?  I am jumping up.  I asked Sister Mik to go.  Why?  Now Im not so sure.  I hope we have fun together.  You know, the way sisters do.

Holden is playing baseball right now.  Let me tell you: there is nothing better than 7 and eight year olds playing ball.  Its the greatest thing ever.  He even got a run the other day, and Prouder, I could not have been.

I miss it here so much.  I will not let it go this long again.  Oh, I mean until the next time I let it go this long.

Okay, then.  Til next time.

I NEED to post something because I know a lot of you have been praying for my mom and thinking about her.  I have 10 minutes before Holden has to go to bed.  So here it is: 

Week One in the Hospital in Lansing:  This is not good.  We Drs cant do anything, here.  Too risky.  Send somewhere else. 

Week Two ITHIL:  Death!  Tumor?  Blood Clot?  Death. We can do nothing here.  You go to Ann Arbor. 

Week Three, Now in Ann Arbor:  Well Shit.  This is a tuffy. 

Week Four-Six, NIAA: Hmmmm.  This is big. 

Week Five, NIAA:  OPERATE!!!   

Week Six:  No operate.  Platelets low.  
                    Operate. 
                   No operate. 
                    Operate. 
                   No operate. 

Week Seven: Okay, now we operate.  But you probably will die.  Wanna just go home?  No?  Okay...Say goodbye. 

Okay, so surgery was suppose to be six hours at LEAST.  After three they called us.  We were worried, but surgeon says, We were able to remove it without cutting!  HUGE TUMOR!!  Sarcoma, but we got all we could see.  Mom in TICU.  This was last Wednesday. 
On Thursday morning they woke her up and took her off the oxygen.  On Friday she got moved to a stepdown unit.  On SUnday we went to visit her and SHES SITTING UP< I KID YOU NOT.  And walking (with a walker) which is something she hasnt done since WEEK ONE. 
She may some home tomorrow or the next day. 
Is cancer. 
Probably elsewhere, too.  We'll see.  At least she gets to come home though.  She REALLY is homesick, and we are too.  For her. 
SO we will deal with the rest as it comes. 

God always answers your prayers.  Maybe not always the way you want Him too, but they ARE answered. 
More later, and thank you to everyone who was sending the positive vibes our way. 
xojen

Because I can only say that "my mother has a tumor on her heart the size of your fist and wrist together" so many times before even I get sick of hearing it.
Because so much of my time has been spent driving to and from UofM hospital that I crash every night.
Because the emotional roller coaster is KILLING me.
Because, once, the doctors told Mik that she should probably call her family, and by the time we got there, Mom was sitting up and looking okay~ish.  False Alarm?  If there is such a thing under these circumstances.
Because not even my little family of two has seen me much these last three weeks.
Because then people you havent even spoken to in MONTHS start crawling out of the woodwork and asking how your mother is.  As if it is any of there business at this point.
Because for a while, there, I became so very numb that even my fingers couldnt feel the keyboard.
Because really?  When your mom is on the cusp of death, everything seems SO inane.

But I have been reading when I get the chance.  It just has seemed, I dont know...too much work? to type in a comment.
But I thank you (spa) for checking up on me and making sure that I have not dropped off the face of the earth, and to see if everything is alright.  And I miss you.

I remember reading that book, but I cant remember what its about.  How dumb.  Thats what I do, though; I read and unless the book really touches me, I forget it.  And, that book has to really get me in a special spot...
But, now I have to read it again, because how my mother directly relates to me as a person has been a prevelant focus in my life for the past three days.
I think it was last March or April when my mother was diagnosed with synovial sarcoma.  It is a rare cancer that affects the muscle and soft tissues.  Now, dont quote me on that, because the doctors are all like  Blah blah blah Cancer blah blah doctor talk.
So we did the surgery to extract it and then the chemo to kill the bits of it floating around and then the radiation to make sure that everything surrounding the tumor was dead.
And, her hair fell out and grew back and then she was better.
And then my brother got into a serious car accident.
And then my dad had double bypass surgery.
And, now my mother is back in the hospital with a blood clot the size of ANN ARBOR on her HEART.  THe doctor said this was the biggest clot he's ever seen and he doesnt even think there is a paper written about something this big.   They've got her on blood thinner (heprin) and it will take a week to see a difference in the clot.  If it works they'll keep her on it for another week.  Then they will do surgery.  But they are hinky about going in there.  Because its so big.
Then they gave her an echocardiogram and found that the clot is really unstable and could embolize in her lungs at any time.  Do you know what that means?  Probably death.
SO they move her to Cardio Care ICU to be able to track her better and all that.
Ugh.  Already Im sick of talking about it.
She seems to be doing ok, though I dont even really know what OK is for her anymore.
And People want to hug you when your mom is on deaths door.  And they want to tell you that it will be Okay, and that We Dont Know Anything Yet.  And Its In Gods Hands. And We Dont Know What Gods Plan Is.
DUH.  Okay?  Duh.  I know.  Quit talking to me. And for goodness sakes Quit Touching Me.  
My moms best friend was there last nite, and all I wanted to do was punch her in the face.  And really make her nose bleed.
I KNOW.  What a bitch I am.
When my mom got out of her first sugery last year, and they found out the tumor was WAY different than what they thought it was and the SURGEONS looked DEPRESSED?  My Aunt Char tried to hug me and I almost knocked her out.
Because what am I going to do without my mom?  What?  How am I going to function?
And its funny because my mom is not who I go to for advice.  She's never been that to me.  She had me when she was 17.  We are like friends.  She never has criticized any decisions Ive made.  She knew I was pregnant before I did.  And, she told me I was pregnant OVER THE PHONE.
I have never wanted to be like my mom.  We are so different.
But we look just exactly alike.  And, you know how some women marry men like their father?  I married my mom.  And she loves Gabe.  She's probably the only person in my family that gets him.  And she's so proud of the life we have together.  And she knows Im a really good mom.
She has known me longer than anybody.  She was My Mom for four years before she was anybody elses mom.  She's mine.
When she's gone, who's gonna know me?
So.  If you've stuck around this long, and you've got a prayer in you, I'd sure appreciate it.

Spa Junkie, that Funky Monkey made reference to Fluid Pudding, so of course, I had to go meander over there for a bit.  And, do you KNOW what I found?
I will tell you that I found this: http://cupcakeblog.com/
It is a blog.  All. About. CUPCAKES!!!!!!!  I kid you not.  I would not joke about such things.  Cupcakes are a joy not to be taken lightly.
As I wandered through Green Tea Bubbled Cupcakeland, I started salivating.  Seriously.  I had to go and get a drool cup.
Now, I cant bake.  This saddens me to levels you would find unimaginable.  But, alas, I cannot.  I buy those Betty Crocker cookies in the bag?  You add a stick of butter to the powder, turn on your Kitchenaid, and WAH LAH (sadly, I do not know how to spell this word correctly...) you have cookies.
I turned to the bagged yum yums after several failed attempts at the perfect sugar cookie, and the perfect chocolate chip cookie.  And the perfect peanut butter cookie.  Funnily enough, I CAN bake Snickerdoodles.  Unfortunately Holden doesnt like Snickerdoodles.  Butt Face, anyway.
But, I digress.
Cupcakeland.  It is filled with the wonderment that is the everyday cupcake.  It is every girls Fantasy World who wishes she could bake.
For the record, by I Cant Bake, I mean, I Cant Bake Cookies. 
Bread, on the other hand,  is a passion of mine.  I bake a mean loaf of bread.  And, to further justify myself, I can Cook.  I make nice with the meal!
I also make nice with the Key Lime Pie...This may be old hat to you, Moog, but when Big Hand's Granny made it, I thought she was a Genius.  I guess that I thought you always needed to Bake pies.
Here goes:

One 9" graham cracker pie crust
One 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk
6 oz Cool Whip
1/2 cup key lime juice.
Mix milk with Cool Whip at medium speed until blended.  Add Key Lim Juice.  Blend well.  Poor into crust and refrigerate for 3 hours.  Top with Cool Whip and whet your whistle.

It is a joy on a hot summer day.  Or a winter day.  Or a Tuesday.

I appreciate the help, I do.  The aid is always nice.  Its good to be able to have Go To People and Places.  But if you look up "alpha" in the dictionary, this is what you come up with:   "having the highest rank of its sex in a dominance hierarchy" and "being the most prominent, talented, or aggressive person in a group".
And, then we have its counterpart, Beta: "The second item in a series or system of classification" and "second in order of importance".
Pardon?
I know these women were just trying to be helpful, but what is really happening is they are alienating a lot of Mothers.
Mothers who used to work and now stay home with the kids are not better than mothers who work, and vice versa.  Mothers who obtain multiple degrees in Higher Learning are no better that the mother who didnt graduate from high school.
There are just Good Moms, and Bad Moms.  And, I think it has very little to do with what you learned in school.
You can read all the Parenting Books that you like, and still screw up your kid!
Being a Good Mom comes from experience.
You dont need the Most High Tech Stroller to be a Good Mom.  You need a stroller that is safe and Moves Your Kid Around.
You do not need a fancy tee shirt that says Alpha Mom Here, to be a good mom, and your kid does not need to wear a matching onesie to show what a Good Mom they have!
Like I said, I appreciate the information.  The information is good, solid info!
But, ALPHA?  Really?  Who says?
Who are these Alpha Moms, anyway?
I will tell you who they are: US!
Its just the word that is getting in my way.  I know that.  It is, after all, just a word.  But enough with the labels, I say.  There shouldn't be Thems' and Those's in Motherhood.  Just Us.  As a united front.
Facing the rearage of our children, which is scary enough without having to worry if you are the Best.

I would like to spend a lot of time pontificating on our Nation's lates horrendous travesty, but I cant.  I dont know what to say, and I dont know how to say it.
As the parent of ONE child, it sends chills up and down my spine at the very thought of sending him away to college.  But, I know, that in time, I will almost completely forget what happened on Monday.  Remember how we all thought that we would never open our mail again after 9/11?  Remember how the very next day we ripped open every envelope without hesitation?
When he is 18, we will pack him up and send him off to the University of his choice (currently its the Uof Miami to be closer to his Favorite Team; the Dolphins).  Im sure that will change.  Gads, I surely hope it does.  With Big Hands working at our local U it would be 1/2 off tuition!
With saddened hearts we will load our son's books and clothes and ipod and shoes and posters up in our SUV and drive him off into the sunset.  We will sit on our hands so that we wont email and/or call him every single second of the day.  He wont come home as often as we'd like.
It will just be us two.  Me and good ole Big Hands.  Part of me cant wait.  Part of me is already sad.  Part of me wishes we'd had another kid.
I dont necessarily want another.  Lord knows we dont need another.  We definitely have our hands full with the one!  But the Very Selfish part of me would like another.  You know.  Just in case.  To take his place.
I know how horrible that sounds.  Trust me.  Because there isnt another child on earth that could possibly fill the shoes of Holden the Great.
But, when I think about him leaving...and he's only one...what if something happens?  Then I'll have none.
SO.  Did we make the Right Choice?  Did we even really Think This One Out?  A vasectomy at 30?  Did we really do that?
Sometimes we both think we made a hasty decision.  We often muse that having another kid would have curbed us from the obviously Crappy Job we have done trying to raise and UN spoiled child.  Because, there are days when I would gladly ring his precious little neck.
I really like having an only child, but he will never be anyones real and biological Uncle.  The first time that really hit me, I started crying right in my lasagna at Bravo's.  Sure, he's got plenty of cousins...but being an Uncle is special.  I know this because my Uncle Steve loves being an Uncle.  And, even at 50, he loves when we call him Uncle Steve.  He told my Gramma so.  
And, I also know because I am an Aunt.  More specifically, I am Maya's Aunt.  And that makes me feel pretty darn good.
I hope he gets married and has six kids.  Im sure gonna love being a Gramma!
See?  Thats the thing, though.  You just will never be 100% sure that you've always made the right decisions.  You can hope.  You can try your best.  But, really...we dont know How Its All Gonna End Up.
All we can do is try our best, show our unconditional love.  And pray.  On your knees, hands raised to the Heavens and pray.

Not that you even asked, but Ive decided that whenever I read a book, I will review it for your pleasure.  Okay, well, maybe it will just be for my own pleasure...I like reviewing books.  It allows me to push my views onto people who have no say in the matter.  You want to review it?  Use YOUR Journal.

Some things you should know first:
1.  I dont want to Learn anything when I read.  That is not to say I do not glean some knowledge from the books I read, but I do not pick books because, oh, say I want to learn about automechanics.  
2.  I read strictly for pleasure.
3.  That is to say, I have this hole between my ears, and I have to fill it with Something.
4.  I read a lot of pith.
5.  I like to read books that make me cry.  Generally, if I didnt cry, I dont think its good.
6.  I really hate the way most books end.

Okay, here it goes.

I just finished reading Three Weeks with my Brother by Nicholas and Micah Sparks.  I usually do not like non fiction.  I have a hard enough time with make believe.  Real Life is scary.  And, I usually dont read Nic Sparks stuff because normally it makes me want to throw up in my mouth a little.  I like pith, but he takes pith to a whole new level...HOWEVER, my boss told me this was a good book, and though I dont generally like her tastes in literature, I thought I would give it a try.  Plus, she told me she choked up a little, so I knew I would cry like a little girl.
Its the story of two brothers trip around the world together, and the life lessons they learn, both from the trip, and, you guessed it, from Each Other.  It is also the story of their childhood.  And, that is the good part.
Even Mr. Sparks will tell you, looking at pottery from around the world gets a little tedious after awhile; reading about it gets even more boring.  I did scan through a lot of that stuff.
I admit it.  Im a scanner...
But, my friends, that is just because I wanted to get to the meatier text.  The Childhood.  If you have siblings, it will make you love them even more.  If you havent any, it will make you wish that you had some.
Family dynamics are what Makes You.  This story certainly gives one pause.  Where would we be, were it not for our upbringing?  WHO would we be if we were raised differently?
I cried through the last 1/4 of the book.  And, I dont mean that I Got a Little Misty.  No, I was sobbing.  Like the deep short breaths kind of weeping.
If you are a big wussy baby girl like me, grab the kleenex.

It IS Nicholas Sparks, though.  So sometimes you wonder how many times can a grown man "fall into" his "brothers arms"?
Many.  Very many.  Everyone was always falling, weeping into someone elses arms.  It did get a little disconcerting at times.

Of course, I am PMSing, so my moods are swinging like monkees on the vine...If you read it, and you have a heart, it will move you even if just a little.  If you dont read it, you wont miss anything.

I WOULD strongly suggest this book if you are going for Familial Fortitude
Its a good, funny, hearbreaking book.  Plus, when you are done, you turn it around, then upside down, and in the back he tells you all the blatant lies that are in the book.
I like Dave Eggers though.  Some dont.  (like Big Hands.  He hated this book, then again, he IS currently reading a very gross book that glows in the dark, and has some very goulish ghosties on the cover.  Its creepy.)
